# NSLocale.LanguageDirection

**Enumeration**

The directions that a language may take across a page of text.

## Declaration

```swift
enum LanguageDirection
```

## Overview

Use these constants with the methods [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSLocale/lineDirection(forLanguage:)] and [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSLocale/characterDirection(forLanguage:)].

## Constants

- **NSLocale.LanguageDirection.unknown**: The direction of the language is unknown.
- **NSLocale.LanguageDirection.leftToRight**: The language direction is from left to right.
- **NSLocale.LanguageDirection.rightToLeft**: The language direction is from right to left.
- **NSLocale.LanguageDirection.topToBottom**: The language direction is from top to bottom.
- **NSLocale.LanguageDirection.bottomToTop**: The language direction is from bottom to top.
- **NSLocale.LanguageDirection.unknown**: The direction of the language is unknown.
- **NSLocale.LanguageDirection.leftToRight**: The language direction is from left to right.
- **NSLocale.LanguageDirection.rightToLeft**: The language direction is from right to left.
- **NSLocale.LanguageDirection.topToBottom**: The language direction is from top to bottom.
- **NSLocale.LanguageDirection.bottomToTop**: The language direction is from bottom to top.

## Initializers

- **init(rawValue:)**

## Getting line and character direction for a language

- **characterDirection(forLanguage:)**: Returns the character direction for a specified language code.
- **lineDirection(forLanguage:)**: Returns the line direction for a specified language code.
- **Locale.LanguageDirection**: An alias for the standard set of language directions.

## Conforms To

- BitwiseCopyable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
